noun.description: A person who attacks and robs ships at sea.

verb.description: Use or reproduce (another's work) for profit without permission, usually in contravention of patent or copyright.
examples: he sold pirated tapes of Hollywood blockbusters
a competing company cannot pirate its intellectual achievements

origin: Middle English: from Latin pirata, from Greek peiratēs, from peirein to attempt, attack (from peira an attempt).
